title: Louis Walsh riles Little Mix fans as he says 'world needs new girl band'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Louis Walsh riled Little Mix fans on The X Factor: Celebrity viewers last night when he made a throwaway comment about ‘the world needing a new girl band.’

The 67-year-old judge, who’s joined Simon Cowell and Nicole Scherzinger on the spin-off ITV competition show, made the jibe as he offered his feedback to group V5 after they auditioned in front of a star-studded crowd.

‘Girls, really well done,’ Louis said. ‘The world needs a new girl band, I think we’re going to see a lot more of you.’

‘I see chemistry, I see people who want to know where they want to go, thank you,’ Simon added.

Although Louis didn’t directly name the band, many were quick to assume he’d forgotten about the success of Leigh-Anne Pinnock, Perrie Edwards, Jesy Nelson,and Jade Thirwall, after they won The X Factor in 2011.

V5 impressed the judges (Picture: Rex)

Little Mix won X Factor in 2011 (Picture: Getty)

Viewers were fuming at Louis Walsh’s comment

Fans were not impressed (Picture: Twitter)

V5, who are five social media influencers, had been together six days before performing together in front of the judges but managed to sail through to the live shows.

‘It was crazy because it was our first performance together as a group,’ one of the girls admitted.

‘After the show, we’d love to go on tour together and stay together as long as we could.’

As the panel deliberated what to do, Louis commented: ‘Simon are you not worried that people will not vote for them because nobody knows them in the UK?’

But Simon wasn’t bothered and gave the girls the green light, telling them: ‘There is no shadow of doubt in my mind that you have to join me please on the live shows.’

The X Factor: Celebrity continues Saturday at 8.20pm on ITV.
